chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Marties Antonio Tate Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $193.62 payable to Jalisco Super Mercado. To be paid first, before any costs, surcharges and assessments are paid.

Pay DNA surcharge, court costs and all applicable  surcharges, assessments. 
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  to be collect from up to 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid during term of Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving the first three (3) years of his sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school fulltime, defendant to have a part time job.  Obtain GED or HSED.  Vocational assessment, participate in any programs recommended.
Mental health assessment. Cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy, and taking any prescribed medications.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No contact with Jalisco Super Mercado located at 2000 W. Lincoln Avenue, Jacqueline E., Delceria La Mexican located at 1104 W. Lincoln Avenue, Javier C.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
If defendant has already provided a DNA sample, defendant does not need to do again.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marties Antonio Tate Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (45 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing DECEMBER 17, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Marties Antonio Tate in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Marties Antonio Tate in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for  10 YEARS,  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of  5 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of  4 1/2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving the first 3 years of his sentence
-Restitution set at $193.62  payable to Jalisco Super Mercado; to be collected by Doc from up to 25% of prison funds.  Restitution to be paid before any costs, surcharges and assessments are paid.  Any remaining balance to be paid while on extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment. If defendant has already provided a DNA sample, defendant does not need to do again.  
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Vocational assessment; participate in any programs recommended 
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-No contact with Jalisco Super Mercado located at 2000 W. Lincoln Avenue,  Jacqueline E., Delceria La Mexicana located at 1104 West Lincoln Avenue, Javier C.
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Marties Antonio Tate not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request an adjournment of the currently scheduled Sentencing hearing.  Deputies were instructed to make sure defendant was not transported back to the prison.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court via telephone, defendant Marties Antonio Tate not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was not produced for today's proceedings, therefore case needed to be adjourned. Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marties Antonio Tate in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Marties Antonio Tate in custody.  
Jeremy Arn for Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty.  On state's motion penalty enhancer "REPEATER" DISMISSED.  The Court ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

AS TO COUNT 2 AND UNCHARGED READ-IN:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on state's motion, the Court ordered Count 2 and uncharged armed robbery (milwaukee police department incident report #150570037) with offense date of 2-26-15, DISMISSED AND READ-IN for the purpose of sentencing in Count 1.

The Court orders the defendant REMANDED pending sentencing before Branch 21.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Marties Antonio Tate not in court, in custody.  
Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea hearing.  Defense request short adjournment.  No objection from the state as ADA St. Junior is in jury trial before Branch 26. Case continued to the A.M.
Case set for Plea hearing on May 07, 2015 at 8:30 a.m. before Branch 2

Defendant Marties Antonio Tate in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Marties Antonio Tate in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Hearing proceeded.  Original Information filed 3-19-15.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of a copy of the Information, waived its reading and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Certification of PRELIMINARY HEARING transcript commencing MARCH 13, 2015 received and filed. (17 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to ALEXIS LIGGINS, PUBLIC DEFENDER, 819 N. 6TH ST. # 908, MILWAUKEE, WI 53203.
Filed by the state:  Certified Record for the defendant.

Defendant Marties Antonio Tate in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Marties Antonio Tate in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Detective Rudy Gudgon. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Case is adjourned to Branch 21.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Pocan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Brash, Br. 21.
  Arraignment scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JALISCO SUPER MERCADO, 2000 W LINCOLN AVE., MILWAUKEE; JAVIER C. AND JACQUELINE E.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Marties Antonio Tate in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Marties Antonio Tate in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
